content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --TPTREF
      operator: empty
    - name: --ELTM
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000028
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is empty, but --ELTM is not empty
Outcome:
  Message: --TPTREF is empty and --ELTM is not empty
  Output Variables:
    - --TPTREF
    - --ELTM
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0008
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The interval of time between a planned time point
                  and a fixed reference point, represented in a standardized character
                  format. The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF.
                Document: SDTM Model v2.0
                Item: --ELTM
                Section: Timing
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0008
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference
                  (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable
                  is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time
                  or a date/time variable, but an interval.   Format=ISO8601
                Document: SDTM Model v1.7
                Item: Table 2.2.5, --ELTM
                Section: 2.2.5
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0008
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format
                  relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous
                  Dose" or "Previous Meal".
                Document: SDTM Model v1.4
                Item: Table 2.2.5, --ELTM
                Section: 2.2.5
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is empty, but --ELTM is not empty

Outcome.Message: --TPTREF is empty and --ELTM is not empty

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The interval of time between a planned time point and a fixed reference point, represented in a standardized character format. The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF.

Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval.   Format=ISO8601
Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal".
